revised_title: An Analysis of the Pleiotropic Effects of a New Lethal Mutation in Rats
tldr: This study investigates a new lethal mutation in rats and its pleiotropic effects. The mutation is linked to two factor pairs, black-eyed versus pink-eyed yellow and normal versus lethal. The research shows that the lethal mutation affects growth, development, and respiratory systems, leading to various symptoms and eventually death. The study provides insights into gene action and pleiotropy in general.
